Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh are hopeful of skipper Shakib Al Hasan getting fit in time for their upcoming ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 match against India.
Shakib Al Hasan suffered a quad tear during Bangladesh-New Zealand match in Chennai.
He had a scan in Chennai shortly after the game, but reportedly, he is pain-free.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh won their first game against Afghanistan in Dharamshala but lost their next encounter to England at the same venue.
They then lost to New Zealand in Chennai.
The match against India will be played on October 19, 2023, at the Maharashtra Cricket Association (MCA) stadium in Pune.
Others: Team director Khaled Mahmud said that Shakib wanted to play, but his inclusion was not so straight-forward.
Mahmud said that they will still be cautious about not risking Shakib with six matches remaining for Bangladesh in the World Cup.
